Para este puesto debes contar con los siguientes requerimientos mínimos:Licenciatura en ciencias de la computación, campos similares o su equivalente en experiencias prácticas.Conocimiento pleno de HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Phyton, XML.Experiencia desarrollando instancias de Odoo desde cero. Conocimiento de configuración de localización Dominicana para Odoo.Experiencia desarrollando o modificando módulos para OdooConocimiento de ingles nivel intermedio (hablado y escrito)Estar disponible 4 horas o más dentro del siguiente horario. (10AM - 10PM EST)Si tienes estos conocimientos sería genial, aunque no es obligatorio para poder aplicar:Experiencia con Wordpress.Familiaridad con WooCommerce.Experiencia en AWS / Google Cloud / Digital Ocean. Experiencia programando y optimizando páginas web altamente escalables.Familiaridad llevando control de versiones con Git.Conocimiento del ingles nivel avanzado (hablado y escrito).Utilizas o haz utilizado Jira (u otra herramienta Scrum) para llevar asignaciones.Acá dejamos una descripción del perfil de nuestros candidatos:Eres una persona proactiva. Te gusta evaluar las diferentes formas de llevar a cabo un objetivo y tomar la mejor decisión.Eres curioso. Te gusta aprender cosas nuevas y siempre andas buscando esa nueva gran idea.Te gustan los retos y las nuevas experiencias. Disfrutas resolver retos donde puedas adquirir nuevos conocimientos.Eres organizado y diligente. Sabes administrar tu tiempo para trabajar y ver Netflix :)Te gustan las buenas prácticas. Siempre estas buscando la mejor forma de hacer tu trabajo. Prefieres invertir más tiempo y no tener que repetir un trabajo.Disfrutas el trabajo en equipo. Sabes trabajar con otros, comunicarte en equipo y aportar ideas al proyecto.¡Esperamos que puedas trabajar con nosotros pronto! :)Equipo de Almacen.doEn Almacen.do, no solo aceptamos la diferencia, la celebramos, la apoyamos y prosperamos en beneficio de nuestros empleados, nuestros productos y nuestra comunidad. Almacen.do se enorgullece de ser un lugar de trabajo con igualdad de oportunidades. Estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo sin importar raza, color, ascendencia, religión, sexo, origen nacional, orientación sexual, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, discapacidad o identidad de género. Si tiene una discapacidad o necesidad especial que requiera alojamiento, háganoslo saber.

title: Ingeniero de Software Mobile Tiempo Completo
description: DescripciónEl Ingeniero de Software Mobile Senior trabaja como líder en los proyectos mobile de la empresa produciendo código de pruebas y ejecución para diversos proyectos de clientes externos.Objetivos? Producir código de ejecución y de pruebas.? Colaborar en el diseño y la arquitectura de los proyectos.? Ser el mentor de los ingenieros mobile junior y mid-level.Requisitos1. Egresado de grado universitario en ingeniería de sistemas y computación o carrera relacionada, con 2+ años de experiencia desarrollando aplicaciones móviles de tipo empresarial. 2. Debe poder construir soluciones haciendo uso de estructuras de datos simples ocomplejas. Por ejemplo: arreglos, listas enlazadas, stacks, queues, graphs y trees.3. Conocimiento y capacidad de aplicación de object oriented design; esta persona debe, dado un problema, poder estructurar su solución en clases, métodos y propiedades.4. Debe demostrar que entiende cómo funciona una aplicación movil y como esta se integra con servicios externos o de terceros. Cualquier capacidad demostrada en las tecnologías representadas en estos keywords es un plus: Android, iOS, React Native, Xamarin, Unity3D, Ionic5. Compresión y capacidad de implementación utilizando el paradigma de functional programming un plus.6. Conocimientos sobre estrategias de testing top down y bottom up así cómo su implementación a través de unit testing y/o integration testing un plus.7. Acostumbrado a utilizar herramientas de control de versiones (GIT) un plus.8. Escribir y leer inglés; esta persona debe poder leer libros, papers técnicos o posts de blog y comprenderlos. Adicionalmente, debe poder generar un resumen de dicha lecturaIgualdad de oportunidadesEl proceso de selección para el presente puesto garantiza el cumplimiento del principio de No-Discriminación por sexo, origen (incluido el racial o étnico), edad, estado civil, discapacidad, religión o convicciones, opinión política, orientación sexual, afiliación sindical, condición social y lengua.Condiciones de contratación? Contrato laboral por tiempo indefinido? Jornada laboral de lunes a viernes (40 horas semanales)? Salario bruto mensual según escala salarial (inferior a RD$ 80,000)? Otros beneficios: Seguro complementario de Salud? Lugar de trabajo: Santo Domingo - Sector NacoLas personas interesadas a la presente convocatoria deberán enviar su curriculum vitae vía nuestra Página de Ofertas de Empleo.

title: Senior DBA Tiempo Completo
description: OBJETIVOS PRINCIPALES DEL PUESTO:El Administrador de Base de Datos Senior es el responsable de implementar, optimizar y realizar mantenimientos preventivos a las diferentes bases de datos asignadas a el. Es el encargado de realizar las recuperaciones, backups, y demás mecanismos de seguridad solicitados. Esta posición requiere una alta capacidad de toma de decisiones y conocimientos de arquitectura a nivel de bases de datos. POSICION EN EL ORGANIGRAMA: Reporta a: Director Ingeníera de Software.Trabaja con/para: Clientes externos.Responsable de: No tiene personal bajo su cargo. REQUERIMIENTOS Y FUNCIONES DEL PUESTO: Educación y experiencia necesaria: 1)      Ingeniería en sistemas de computación o carreras afines, con un enfoque en bases de datos relacionales. Habilidades técnicas deseadas: ·         4 o más años de experiencia con Microsoft SQL Server (2008+)·         3 o más años de experiencia en configurando e implementando bases de datos tipo SQL en ambientes de prueba y producción.·         2 o más años de experiencia realizando troubleshooting en SQL Server; capacidad de detectar proactivamente fallos y posibles problemas.·         Experiencia realizando optimizaciones para mejorar el rendimiento (PTO) en las bases de datos, utilizando herramientas de monitoreos nativas.·         Experiecia realizando backups, restores y recovery models.·         Conocimientos de High Availability (HA) y Disaster Recovery (DR) en SQL Server. Funciones principales del puesto: ·         Administrar diversas bases de datos SQL a través de las diferentes partes del ciclo de vida de la aplicación.·         Configurar y mantener el correcto estado de las bases de datos, los servidores y servicios asociados.·         Resolver problemas relacionados a las bases de datos en tiempo real.·         Automatizar procesos para eficientizar el trabajo operativo.·         Realizar reportes y documentar procesos relacionados.·         Realizar mantenimientos progrramados a los sistemas asignados.·         Asistir a los Desarrolladores en la realización de querys complejos.·         Proveer mentoría y coaching a los demás miembros del equipo de Ingeniería de Software. Igualdad de oportunidades:El proceso de selección para el presente puesto garantiza el cumplimiento del principio de No-discriminación por sexo, origen (incluido racial o étnico), edad, estado civil, discapacidad, religión o convicciones, opinión política, orientación sexual, afiliación sindical, condición social y lengua.Condiciones de contratación:·         Contrato laboral por tiempo indefinido·         Jornada laboral de lunes a viernes (40 horas semanales)·         Salario bruto mensual según escala salarial (inferior a RD$ 80,000)·         Otros beneficios: Seguro complementario de Salud·         Lugar de trabajo: Santo Domingo.?Las personas interesadas en la presente convocatoria deberán enviar llenar el formulario de aplicación en nuestra Página de Ofertas de Empleo.

title: Software Developer IV Tiempo Completo
description:
A Software Developer is responsible to build and implement
functional programs, working alongside with other Developers and Product
Managers throughout the software development life cycle. In this role, a
Software Developer should be a team player with a keen eye for detail and
problem-solving skills.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Work with cross-functional teams
     to fulfill requirements for requested changes.
Follow and support documented
     software development policies and procedures as well as coding standards.
Write code for new and existing
     applications.
Create programming tasks based on
     requirements analysis.
Ensure code quality by performing
     tests over it.
Perform code reviews to other team
     members.
Understand, develop and test
     requested changes to ensure the implementation of quality solutions on
     time.
Troubleshoot issues and provide
     quick solutions based on SLAs.
Results driven and capable of
     working in a fast-paced environment.

title: FRONT END DEVELOPER Tiempo Completo
description:
The opportunity
Joining the Developemt Engineering team (squads) at Edupass is an
opportunity to help shape the future of Edupass.
 What can you expect from us?
·        
We’ll believe and trust in
you and your abilities. You and your team will have the authority to make the
technical decisions you need to meet your responsibilities.
·        
The opportunity to become an
authoritative voice within the engineering team of a large and successful, but
still fast growing company.
·        
An environment in which
good, evidence-based arguments are listened to.
·        
5 days for training of your
choice each year, and support toward the costs.
·        
Regular 1-2-1 meetings with
your Technology Manager, with support and guidance to set and then meet
personal career objectives.
·        
An open, friendly and fun
environment; we have a relaxed dress code and regular social events, including.
·        
Hackathons – use your
imagination, ideas and technologies of your choice to innovate and deliver
prototypes of new products.
·        
The opportunity to get
involved in Open Source projects.
 
You should apply if:
The successful candidate will help the team in the latest web
technologies and front-end development practices.
The dev team values the following:
·        
Continually delivering high
quality code to all our customers
·        
Continual
learning and improvement
·        
Caring
about and encouraging others
·        
Collaborating with our users
 to create the right product
Some things that may surprise you:
·        
Teams at Jane own their
product in its entirety and are responsible for keeping it clean and up to date
·        
Continual delivery means
more than one production release per day is not uncommon
·        
Our leadership team values
our feedback by acting on it -- developers are central to our Product process
Qualifications
·        
React
·        
Functional
state management (Redux)
·        
Node.js (Koa, Express,
GraphQL)
·        
Modern dev tools, including
TypeScript, Flow, and Webpack
·        
HTTP, REST, WebSockets, and
GraphQL fundamentals
·        
Git,
GitHub, CI
·        
Docker,
Linux
·        
PHP
We also use these technologies and tools (including backend):
·        
RabbitMQ
·        
Redis
·        
AWS
·        
Docker

you’re keen to learn more

you’re comfortable working

you have some experience

That sounds super exciting, but… Do I have what it takes?

You are a back-end engineer

DevOps Engineer Medio tiempo
Remoto
description:
This is a remote, home-based position.
Scopic Software (https://scopicsoftware.com/careers/) is the largest virtual software company in the world. We
have over 200 employees in 25 different countries. All employees work from
home. We develop custom software applications for clients in North America and
Europe. The company is looking to hire a talented DevOps Engineer. Work hours are flexible. Projects
are interesting and challenging.
 
 
You will be responsible for:
•  
Automating
flow of source code modifications from development to production, i.e.
continuous integration
•  
Experience
with CD/CI in Cloud as well as with On-prem infrastructure
•  
Automating
and testing the deployment pipeline, i.e. continuous delivery
•  
Closely
collaborate with Product as well as Operations teams
•  
Work
with team to define and implement the continuous delivery pipeline
•  
Driving
automation improvements
 
As a successful candidate you have to be able to work
independently or in a small team. You are a self-starter, team player with
analytic skills and attention to detail. You are interested in cutting edge
technologies and development background.
 
Requirements:
•  
3+
years professional working experience
•  
Understanding
of concepts around Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery 
   and experience implementing these concepts
•  
Experience
with Java, Junit, C/C++ and SQL (at least basics)
•  
Experience
automating and managing builds using Maven highly desirable
•  
Puppet
experience is beneficial
•  
Proficient
in Git
•  
Solid
understanding of an application build lifecycle & steps needed to validate
a build
•  
Solid
understanding of Linux operating systems
•  
Experience
with Agile Software Development methodologies and development 
   lifecycle knowledge
•  
Have
a passion for technology and learning new technologies
•  
Exceptionally
strong written and verbal communication skills in English
•  
Good
interpersonal skills and organizational skills
•  
Bachelor’s
degree or higher
•  
Good
PC and internet connection.
 
Technologies:
•  
Programming
Languages: Java, C++ (beneficial to have)
•  
Operating
systems: Windows and Linux
•  
Software
build tools: Maven
•  
Scripting
languages: Bash
•  
Source
control systems: Git
•  
Other
systems/tools: Jenkins CI Server, Artifactory, Bamboo, Jira, Stash, TeamCity
 
Nice to have:
•  
Experience
in Telco – IP telephony area
•  
Enjoy
and thrive in an agile, fast-moving, ever-changing environment
 
 
This is a full-time position.
Candidate must be able to work 9-5 in UTC+2
 
Hourly
range rate is $18-$22/hour depending on experience and skills.
 
 
Please apply online: https://scopicsoftware.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0fa5p
Or
send your English CV and hourly rate expectations to: jobs@scopicsoftware.com

title:
Intermediate PHP/Laravel Developer Medio tiempo
Remoto
description:
This
is a remote, home-based position. Full-time.
Start a career with the world’s largest
virtual company.
Flexible,
stable hours - Your own space to grow - Competitive compensation.
About
us
At Scopic Software, we have over 250
employees in over 30 countries all comfortably working from home/remotely.
Though we’re a big team overall, each project is made up of small teams to
remain agile and maintain good communication. As a skilled PHP/Laravel
Developer, you would be part of a dedicated team for web application
development projects and an integral part of Scopic.
Since a good work environment is
crucial to creativity, the position gives you the freedom to work from
anywhere, at any time. We value and respect every member of our team and
encourage transparency in all areas of our work.
Now Hiring for an Intermediate PHP/Laravel Developer
 
As part of the project team, your role
will include leveraging the latest tools and technology to develop a diverse selection
of web applications, as well as collaborating with your team in building
innovative software products.
To start with, you will be working on a
dynamic social media and contact center integration platform to assist
businesses with their customer services via social and other messaging
services. You will be working mainly on back-end development, but if you are
working as a full-stack developer with React and JavaScript, this is a plus. 
Some of our projects that
have involved PHP/Laravel include; a leading business and financial news
application, sales and lead generation apps, digital signage solutions, and
others. 
 
 
About you
You are a skilled PHP developer (full stack is a
bonus), a problem solver, a creative and analytical thinker who enjoys the
security of regular projects and values the advantages of working remotely. You
communicate well in English, take pride in producing your best work and deliver
on schedule.
 
 
Required Skills:
·        
3+
years of software development experience
·        
Excellent
back-end and front-end programming skills
·        
Proficiency
with PHP, Laravel and Lumen frameworks
·        
Experience
with JavaScript and AngularJS
·        
Experience
with HTML, HTML5, and CSS
·        
Proficiency
in SQL (e.g., MySQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB) databases
·        
Experience
implementing modern user interfaces
·        
Experience
developing multi-tiered scalable and secure web applications

title: Oracle QA Automation Analyst Tiempo Completo
description:
*Job Qualifications•  Generally requires BS Degree in an IT or business field or equivalent work experience•  Typically has 1-4 years of directly related experience.•  Knowledge on Oracle financials (AP, AR,GL, FA,..) •  Knowledge of Java and the Oracle testing suite supporting Oracle – OATS is a plus•  Working knowledge of quality assurance and acceptance testing methodologies.•
  Read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, 
professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations.•  Good interpersonal and communication skills.•  Understand the concepts of structured testing and development methodologies.•  Basic knowledge of test case design techniques such as all-pairs, equivalence partitioning, and boundary value analysis.•  Collaborate closely with US & offshore QA Analysts and software development teams. Dutieso  This position participates directly in manual and automated software test guidelines and standards. o  The Test Analyst will analyze business, technical and functional requirements transferring them into supporting test plans and execute those test plans while adhering to software test guidelines and standards. o  The Test Analyst will participate as a project team member with Business Analysts, Developers and interface partners and will provide direction and support to an extended team of on and offshore QA Analysts.  o  The Test Analyst should have experience with smoke, regression and automation testing practice framework as well as exposure to automation tools, preferably Oracle Automated Testing Suite (OATS).o  Evaluates and tests new or modified software programs and software development procedures to ensure that programs developed throughout the company function according to user requirements and conform to established guidelines. o  Support responsibilities will include the development and execution of test scripts for new and/or modified software applications and software development procedures and standards.o  Performs tests of software to ensure proper operation and freedom from defects. o  Documents and works to resolve all problems and reports progress on problem resolution to management.o  May review new or modified programs, including documentation, diagram, and flow chart, to determine if the program (a) performs according to the user request; and (b) conforms to guidelines.o  Sets up tests at the request of users to locate and correct program operating errors following the installation of programs.o  Assists the Programmers and Business analysts in developing application test plans and verifying that applications and programs have been tested according to plan.o  Develop automated scripts for regression, load, and performance testing.o  Maintain the perspective of the end-user to ensure that the software will function optimally in the business process environment.o  Generate suitable test data that validate the critical requirements and business rules of the application under test to expose regressive defects.

Sabes trabajar con otros, comunicarte en equipo y aportar ideas al proyecto.¡Esperamos que puedas trabajar con nosotros pronto! :)Equipo de Almacen.doEn Almacen.do, no solo aceptamos la diferencia, la celebramos, la apoyamos y prosperamos en beneficio de nuestros empleados, nuestros productos y nuestra comunidad. Almacen.do se enorgullece de ser un lugar de trabajo con igualdad de oportunidades. title: Scrum Master Tiempo Completo
description: Encargado por velar por que todos los participantes del proyecto sigan los valores y principios ágiles, las reglas y proceso de Scrum y guiar la colaboración intraequipo y con el cliente de manera que las sinergias sean máximas. Esto implica:- Asegurar que exista una lista de requisitos priorizada y que esté preparada antes de la siguiente iteración.- Facilitar las reuniones de Scrum (planificación de la iteración, reuniones diarias de sincronización del equipo, demostración, retrospectiva), de manera que sean productivas y consigan sus objetivos.Encargado de quitar los impedimentos que el equipo tiene en su camino para conseguir el objetivo de cada iteración y poder finalizar el proyecto con éxito. Estos obstáculos se identifican de manera sistemática en las reuniones diarias de sincronización del equipo y en las reuniones de retrospectiva.Encargado de proteger y aislar al equipo de interrupciones externas durante la ejecución de la iteración (introducción de nuevos requisitos, "secuestro" no previsto de un miembro del equipo, etc.). De esta manera, el equipo puede mantener su productividad y el compromiso que adquirió sobre los requisitos que completaría en la iteración.Requisitos de EducaciónIngeniero de sistemas o Ingeniero en Desarrollo de Software.Preferible Certificación de Scrum Master.Requisitos de ExperienciaExperiencia como Project Manager o Scrum Master (mínimo 1 años)Experiencia en desarrollo (mínimo 2 años)Competencias Técnicas Experiencia en Scrum (mínimo 1 año)Dominio de ciclo de vida de Software.Experiencia en Sistemas Operativos UNIX/LINUX, WindowsExperiencia en Herramientas de Desarrollo, preferible GIT,Jenkins,Jira, Ant, Maven, RTC...Facilidad de expresión verbal y escrita.Inglés (lee-habla-escribe).Competencias conductuales ? description:
ATTENTION: WE'RE LOOKING FOR AN ACCOUNTING OR FINANCE PROFESSIONAL WITH 2+ YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN PLANNING & BUDGETING WHO'S WILLING TO LEARN IT PROCESSES AND SERVICES. BELOW MORE DETAILS:The Financial Analyst will help drive the monthly and quarterly 
financial forecasting and reporting process and perform value-added 
analysis to assist in decision making. This position is responsible for 
identifying business risks and opportunities and seeking process 
improvement in the core functions of the department.
Essential Functions:• Analyze monthly financial results and summarize results of operations.•
 Organize, prepare, standardize and improve efficiency of monthly and 
quarterly earnings processes as it relates to reports and analysis that 
the department performs in support of these functions.• Assist 
in managing the design/development of new management 
reports; and ensuring the data integrity of all management reports 
produced in the group.• Create executive-quality PowerPoint 
presentations to communicate results of quarterly forecasts, results of 
ad hoc analyses, and to present information to our various stakeholders.
Job Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or equivalent combination of education and experience•
 2-4 years of hands-on experience performing forecasting/budgeting, 
performing variance analysis, developing sophisticated financial models 
while working within a Financial Planning & Analysis department.• Experience using formal budgeting/forecasting tools and ERP systems; Hyperion Planning and Oracle Essbase preferred.•
 Finance and Accounting – Experience in finance, economic and accounting
 principles and practices, the financial markets, financial statements, 
valuation and the analysis and reporting of financial data.• Computer Skills – Advanced on Microsoft Office Products, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.• Good communication English skills (written & verbal).

title: IT QA Analyst Tiempo Completo
description: o  This position participates directly in manual and automated software test guidelines and standards. o  The Test Analyst will analyze business, technical and functional requirements transferring them into supporting test plans and execute those test plans while adhering to software test guidelines and standards. o  The Test Analyst will participate as a project team member with Business Analysts, Developers and interface partners and will provide direction and support to an extended team of on and offshore QA Analysts.  o  The Test Analyst should have experience with smoke, regression and automation testing practice framework as well as exposure to automation tools, preferably Oracle Automated Testing Suite (OATS).o  Evaluates and tests new or modified software programs and software development procedures to ensure that programs developed throughout the company function according to user requirements and conform to established guidelines. o  Support responsibilities will include the development and execution of test scripts for new and/or modified software applications and software development procedures and standards.o  Performs tests of software to ensure proper operation and freedom from defects. o  Documents and works to resolve all problems and reports progress on problem resolution to management.o  May review new or modified programs, including documentation, diagram, and flow chart, to determine if the program (a) performs according to the user request; and (b) conforms to guidelines.o  Sets up tests at the request of users to locate and correct program operating errors following the installation of programs.o  Assists the Programmers and Business analysts in developing application test plans and verifying that applications and programs have been tested according to plan.o  Develop automated scripts for regression, load, and performance testing.o  Maintain the perspective of the end-user to ensure that the software will function optimally in the business process environment.o  Generate suitable test data that validate the critical requirements and business rules of the application under test to expose regressive defects.*Job Qualifications•  Generally requires BS Degree in an IT or business field or equivalent work experience•  Typically has 1-4 years of directly related experience.•  Knowledge on Oracle financials (AP, AR,GL, FA,..) •  Knowledge of Java and the Oracle testing suite supporting Oracle – OATS is a plus.•  Working knowledge of quality assurance and acceptance testing methodologies.•  Read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations.•  Good interpersonal and communication skills.•  Understand the concepts of structured testing and development methodologies.•  Basic knowledge of test case design techniques such as all-pairs, equivalence partitioning, and boundary value analysis.•  Collaborate closely with US & offshore QA Analysts and software development teams.

title: Business Analyst Tiempo Completo
description: Passionate about Cloud Technology? Client Engagement? Process Improvement?We are a team of world-class consultants, business analysts, platform specialists and developers who solve people / culture, process, technology and data-related challenges across various industries.We are seeking Business Analysts to join our global team.This is a truly unique role, offering the right candidate to balance of project management and technology consulting duties in a dynamic environment. You would be working with global organizations and their executives while being surrounded by incredibly talented colleagues as you solve strategic business problems.You will embark on an exciting growth path where you will be mentored and trained in world-class project management methodologies with hands-on, collaborative learning through experiential work on client projects as well as content-based learning through robust training resources.ABOUT ChinolaCloud (V2 Strategic Advisors "V2" Sister Company)ChinolaCloud is the nearshore office for V2 Strategic Advisors providing development and project management support to V2's global client base. V2 is a boutique management and technology consultancy headquartered in New York City with offices in the US and Latin America. We specialize in process improvement, organizational change management and Cloud systems integration for global organizations. We have been a Salesforce.com partner for 10+ years and work with prominent media companies across print, digital, programmatic, business information services, entertainment and other media sectors. What sets V2 apart is our years of experience in solving some of the most challenging strategic and operational challenges in media through our focused and agile approach.Our strategy is simple: build a world-class team of individuals who collaborate around Cloud technology and industry best practices. Clients quickly realize that V2 and ChinolaCloud's incredibly talented developers, business analysts, platform specialists and consultants, industry-specific solutions and agile delivery framework help to streamline the process and provide results quickly.SNAPSHOTTeamwork / Culture - Our boutique culture is refreshing. Begin and end your work day with a group of incredibly talented, growth-minded people who embrace humility, teamwork and a common set of core values. Our clients consistency praise the way we work and the results we deliver with integrity. It's energizing to be part of a winning team.Your Day - ChinolaCloud and V2 leverages best-in-class Cloud technologies like Slack, Google for Work, Todoist and Salesforce - and, of course, we are "Mac people". Every day begins with a virtual team, scrum over coffee, where we share our successes, overcome hurdles and refine our approach to projects.Growth - Experience continuous mentorship and growth based on ChinolaCloud's / V2's unique "JPC" program. JPC helps each team member, regardless of your professional experience, perform growth and balance spanning Job, Personal Life and Career. As part of our recruitment process, you will begin to build an individualized JPC plan across key focus areas. From your first week, we will provide growth opportunities through client engagements and individually tailored or group JPC trainings. Collaborative bi-annual reviews focused on past and future growth in key focus areas ensure more structured feedback in addition to weekly mentoring.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESManage, in conjunction with Senior Consultants, key project activities on-time and within budget through effective project governance; clear written, verbal and aural communication and management of client expectationsManage, in conjunction with Senior Consultants, day-to-day interactions with clients at levels including individual contributors, managers and executivesCreate, maintain and distribute project-related communications and documentationCollaborate with project team members to oversee the execution of technical deliverables across configuration, data and integrationContinually build and draw upon a range of professional skills including meeting management, whiteboarding, conflict resolution, email communication, small and large group presentations and other skills deemed necessary for effective project managementCollaborate with team members throughout the engagement lifecycle spanning solution design, build, testing, deployment and post go-live supportParticipate in and help drive client conversations around people, process, technology and data-related challengesSupport requirements gathering and work in conjunction with Senior Consultants to translate requirements into technical specificationsPresent, in conjunction with Senior Consultants, proposed solution designs and gain feedback from clients through user testing sessionsWork with senior team members to map out key process flows, develop pros / cons, document findings and present recommendations to clientsContribute to the creation of high-quality solution designs and implementations by leveraging ChinolaCloud's established systems, tools, organizational knowledge and processesDESIRED CAPABILITIES AND EXPERIENCEMinimum three (3) to five (5) years of professional experienceBachelor's degree in engineering, economics, technology or businessProven ability to heavily utilize computers and software; coding skills a plusStrong communication skills in English both verbal and written (we recognize you are not native speaker and we will help you grow)Strong organizational, task and project management skillsAbility to adapt quickly to fast-paced environmentsStrong organization and productivity skillsInternational living and working experience a plusPrior experience working within the US or with US companies to plus

title: Software Quality Assurance Mid-level Tiempo Completo
description: Software Quality Assurance Mid-levelDescription:GBH is looking for an experienced Mid-level Software Quality Assurance to plan, design, execute and automate tests. We have Agile and waterfall teams so previous experience working in a QA Team in these framework(s) is a must. The Individual chosen for this position should be a hands-on Software QA Analyst with proven technical and analytical skills. If you enjoy a highly collaborative environment, then this position might be for you!Responsibilities:Participate in the whole software development lifecycle by reviewing documentation and making sure they meet good quality standards.Direct analysis of documentation and technical specifications for any application under deployment or consideration to determine its intended functionalityPlan tests based on formal and informal documentation by creating well-structured Test Plans.Design tests by creating well detailed Test Cases and Test Scripts.Create more efficient regression testing efforts by automating manual tests.Execute manual tests for front-end and back-end working environments.Report defects, bugs and errors on any application under test.Follow up on reported issues during the bugs lifecycle.Be a mentor for Junior QA staff. Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related Leadership Ability to work as a teamExperience:Experience using a variety of software development methodologies (Waterfall, Phase Gate, SCRUM, Kanban, etc.) Experience in modern test automation 1+ years of overall experience delivering enterprise-class software solutions Familiarity with bug and feature tracking systems such as JIRA a plus. Experience using a variety of software development methodologies (Waterfall, Phase Gate, SCRUM, Kanban, etc.) Testing environment include a variety of web and mobile solutions that include: React.js, Angular 1 and 2, Java, .NET, PHP, Elixir, Node.js, React Native, Android and IOS.Equal opportunities:The selection process for this position ensures compliance with the principle of non-discrimination by sex, origin (including racial or ethnic), age, marital status, disability, religion or belief, political opinion, sexual orientation, union affiliation, social status and language.Terms of recruitment:Indefinite employment contract Working day from Monday to Friday (40 hours a week) Monthly Salary less than RD$ 45,000 Great environment Complementary health insurance  Place of work: Santo Domingo - Sector NacoEnrollment Process:Interested candidates must send their CV though our job posting page.Only candidates whose applications have been selected for personal interviews will be contacted.

title: Gestor de Proyectos Tiempo Completo
description: Objetivo del puesto:Asegurar el desempeño óptimo de todas las etapas del proyecto para impulsar el avance del mismo, mediante la toma de decisiones tendentes a la consecución de los objetivos; priorizando el cumplimiento de los compromisos, la gestión racional y efectiva de los recursos y la satisfacción del cliente.DESCRIPCIÓN DE FUNCIONES?  Planifica, coordina la ejecución y lleva el control de todas las actividades de los proyectos a su cargo.?  Maximiza el uso de los recursos (humanos, tecnológicos y financieros) para lograr la ejecución eficiente y eficaz de los proyectos en relación a sus costos operativos sin sacrificar la satisfacción del cliente.?  Elabora y mantiene actualizada la documentación relacionada con cada proyecto.?  Asegura el cumplimiento del cronograma de cada proyecto, mediante la gestión de las actividades diarias, seguimiento constante al rendimiento del equipo y el control de los hitos entregables programados.?  Distribuye las tareas entre los consultores e ingenieros de soporte involucrados en los proyectos a su cargo, tomando en consideración la especialidad de cada miembro del equipo, la carga de trabajo que tenga asignada y la disponibilidad de cada uno.?  Ofrece retroalimentación oportuna a los miembros su equipo y a los supervisores de los proyectos por parte de los clientes.?  Identifica oportunamente los riesgos que afectan directamente las probabilidades de éxito del proyecto, y los controla mediante la constante medición (formal e informalmente) de dichos riesgos a lo largo del ciclo de vida del proyecto.?  Elabora y presenta informes de avances de proyectos al Cliente y a la Gerencia de Entrega de Servicio y mantiene la información actualizada en el ERP de la organización.?  Crea los canales y se mantiene en constante comunicación con los clientes, mediante visitas a sus instalaciones y haciendo uso de las diferentes tecnologías disponibles.?  Recibe y tramita las demandas, quejas y requerimientos de los clientes en relación a los proyectos a su cargo.?  Gestiona la impresión del material de apoyo para las capacitaciones dentro de los proyectos que lo requieran.?  Asume el rol de facilitador para brindar capacitación dentro de los proyectos que así lo requieran.Requisitos de EducaciónIngeniero de sistemas, Ingeniero en Desarrollo de Software o carreras afines.Requisitos de Experiencia?  Mínimo tres (3) años desempeñando cargos similares.Competencias Técnicas?  Tener acreditado un curso de Gestión de Proyectos según la Guía del PMBOK® u otra. - Recomendable?  Poseer la Certificación PMP® - Recomendable?  Habilidades para la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles  y formales.?  Dominio de ciclo de vida de Software.?  Gestión de riesgos inherentes a la naturaleza de la organización.?  Capacidad para estimar el tiempo dedicado a un proyecto mediante el cálculo de las horas/hombre.?  Visión sistémica del negocio y experto conocimiento del mercado.?  Habilidad de síntesis y redacción de informes.?  Facilidad de expresión verbal y escrita.?  Conocimientos básicos del idioma Inglés (lee-habla-escribe).

description: Encargado por velar por que todos los participantes del proyecto sigan los valores y principios ágiles, las reglas y proceso de Scrum y guiar la colaboración intraequipo y con el cliente de manera que las sinergias sean máximas. title: Front End Developer Tiempo Completo
description:
Front End Developer
 
We’ve created InstaCarro
and built a robust tech platform: with more than 22 Million dollars in funds
raised and with our tech team located in Santo Domingo, Zona Colonial. 
That is just the
beginning, and we’re super proud of it. But the best is yet to come.
Relentlessly discovering
and inventing new ideas and technologies that will make things better for
partners and customers, and bringing them together around a better mobility services.
We’re proud of what
we’ve built, and the countless ways we’ve connected people that wants to sell
their car with hundres of buyers that will buy the car in less than 90 minutes,
instead of months. Now we can’t wait to make it even better - we’re creating
the world’s greatest mobility platform!
The opportunity
Joining the Developemt
Engineering team (squads) at InstaCarro is an opportunity to help shape the
future of InstaCarro. 
 
What can you expect from
us?

We’ll believe and trust in you and your
     abilities. You and your team will have the authority to make the technical
     decisions you need to meet your responsibilities.
The opportunity to become a authoritative voice
     within the engineering team of a large and successful, but still fast
     growing company.
An environment in which good, evidence-based
     arguments are listened to.
5 days for training of your choice each year, and
     support toward the costs.
Regular 1-2-1 meetings with your Technology
     Manager, with support and guidance to set and then meet personal career
     objectives.
An open, friendly and fun environment; we have a
     relaxed dress code and regular social events, including beers every
     Friday.
Hackathons – use your imagination, ideas and
     technologies of your choice to innovate and deliver prototypes of new
     products.
The opportunity to get involved in Open Source
     projects.

 
You should apply if:
The successful candidate will help the team in the
latest web technologies and front-end development practices.
 
The dev team values the following:

Continually delivering high quality code to all
     our customers
Continual
     learning and improvement
Caring
     about and encouraging others
Collaborating with our users  to create the
     right product

Some things that may surprise you:

Teams at Jane own their product in its entirety
     and are responsible for keeping it clean and up to date
Continual
     delivery means more than one production release per day is not uncommon
Our leadership team values our feedback by acting
     on it -- developers are central to our Product process

Qualifications

React 
Functional
     state management (Redux)
Node.js
     (Koa, Express, GraphQL)
Modern dev
     tools, including TypeScript, Flow, and Webpack
HTTP,
     REST, WebSockets, and GraphQL fundamentals
Git,
     GitHub, CI
Docker, Linux 

We also use these technologies and tools (including
backend):

RabbitMQ
Redis
AWS
Docker

title: Test Automation Engineer Tiempo Completo
description:
Test Automation Engineer
 
We’ve created InstaCarro
and built a robust tech platform: with more than 22 Million dollars in funds
raised and with our tech team located in Santo Domingo, Zona Colonial. 
That is just the
beginning, and we’re super proud of it. But the best is yet to come.
Relentlessly discovering
and inventing new ideas and technologies that will make things better for
partners and customers, and bringing them together around a better mobility services.
We’re proud of what
we’ve built, and the countless ways we’ve connected people that wants to sell
their car with hundres of buyers that will buy the car in less than 90 minutes,
instead of months. Now we can’t wait to make it even better - we’re creating
the world’s greatest mobility platform!
The opportunity
Joining the Automation
Engineering team at InstaCarro is an opportunity to help shape the future of
Devops at InstaCarro. While Developers own their own code all the way through
to production. It is our responsibility to ensure they have the best tools and
visibility of their packages during the deployment pipeline and once in
production. We produce tools to assist with live operating of the platform, as
well as pre production tooling for load tests and failure injection reporting.
As the Test Automation Engineer in the Automation team you would have a wide
reaching role assisting and advising a wide range of InstaCarro product teams
on deployment and test strategies. As well as responsibilities for monitoring
and driving adoption of testing frameworks and patterns. Internally in the team
you will also play a more standard QA role with the development of the internal
tools.
What can you expect from
us?

We’ll believe and trust in you and your
     abilities. You and your team will have the authority to make the technical
     decisions you need to meet your responsibilities.
The opportunity to become a authoritative voice
     within the engineering team of a large and successful, but still fast
     growing company.
An environment in which good, evidence-based
     arguments are listened to.
5 days for training of your choice each year, and
     support toward the costs.
Regular 1-2-1 meetings with your Technology
     Manager, with support and guidance to set and then meet personal career
     objectives.
An open, friendly and fun environment; we have a
     relaxed dress code and regular social events, including beers every
     Friday.
Hackathons – use your imagination, ideas and
     technologies of your choice to innovate and deliver prototypes of new
     products.
The opportunity to get involved in Open Source
     projects.

What we expect from you
Our engineering teams
are growing the job of keeping the platform alive and healthy is even harder
than ever. As a Test Automation Engineer in Automation Team you will need to
play a key role helping ensure our teams have the tools and processes required
to practise DevOps. You’ll need to:

Coach and mentor individuals for best test
     practices.
Own the roadmap and adoption of our performance
     testing tools.
Conceptual ownership of our staging environment
     to help ensure bad releases are caught as early in the pipeline as
     possible.
Help the company improve test process and
     automation in agile environment.
Engineer solid, reliable automated tests that are
     considered as reliable as production code.
Ensure that all the teams have the right level of
     test coverage for the product, functional and non-functional tests.
Gain the trust and respect of other teams inside InstaCarro
     to help influence their testing strategies.
Lead the testing strategy of migrations as we
     roll out the InstaCarro platform to new acquisitions.
Contribute to the development and evolution of
     our internal testing tools.

Required skills and
experience
Skills and Experience
We’d like to hear from
you if you are confident testing in a collaborative, agile environment. We
expect you to be comfortable working with software engineers, configuring
environments, looking in databases, automating test and building frameworks.
Skills

Test automation (Selenium)
Exploratory testing
Challenging scope requirements
Performance testing (JMeter)
Configuring Continuous Integration environments
     and supporting Continuous Deployments
Working knowledge of AWS infrastructure
Team work , communication skills and fully
     commited to deadlines

Experiences

Writing automated tests
Performance profiling and tuning
Designing and developing systems for both high
     availability and scalability
Message queues and event-driven services
Continuous Integration / Deployment
Common test automation design patterns.
REST Web Services and HTTP
Test Driven and Behavior Driven development
     practices and tools/frameworks
Exposure to cloud (AWS, Google Cloud etc.)

reliability and efficiency are watch words for you and you go to great lengths
to ensure infrastructure is resilient and secure. You are familiar with a
variety of infrastructure technologies and tools including Linux, CloudStack,
OpenStack, AWS, firewalls, load balancers, NewRelic and more.
 
 
You are familiar managing
complex routing and redirection through software and network devices and can
analyse traffic and system load to remove bottlenecks and identify how best we
can deploy resources across the platform. You have a good grasp of tcp/ip, http
and https and use this knowledge to help you analyse problems when they occur.
 
You will have
considerable experience working alongside developers and testers to configure
and tune systems built using technologies such as Nginx, Node, Java. You understand
the concepts behind NoSQL, backup and replication and have an appreciation of
database tuning.
You have an eye on the
future, understand IaaS providers such as AWS and have an interest in using
containerisation and 12 factor applications to further improve the way we can
leverage our investment in infrastructure.
 

Experience with continuous integration tools and
platforms, such as Jenkins, Maven, or TravisCI. 

Experience with containerization tools such as
Docker, OpenShift, or Kubernetes or Cloud Foundry. 

Experience with scripting languages, such
PowerShell, Bash, PHP, Python. 

Experience with Cloud Service Providers (CSP),
such as AWS, Cloud Foundry, or Google Computing Cloud. 

Experience in working in an agile software
development team. 

A quick learner who is looking for new
challenges and responsibilities in an innovative software company. 
 
The following skills are
desirable but not essential:
Knowledge of micro service architecture and
design patterns. 

In return, we offer you a creative and
challenging environment where you have the opportunity to use exciting new
technology to make a real difference in the mobility industry. As the business grows
and develops there will opportunity to develop yourself and to grow with the
business. 
 
Characteristics &
Behaviours
As a DevOps engineer you
will be expected to:

Deliver first-class systems, which are secure, appropriately
     tested, perform well, and help provide an engaging customer experience
Play a proactive part in owning the tribes technical environments
     and services; taking responsibility for support, monitoring, measuring
     performance and addressing technical issues when required
Contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of
     configuration practices, application quality, tooling and agile processes
Manage and maintain our environment pipeline, ensuring
     repeatability and ease of use Create and maintain quality technical
     documentation
Participate in code reviews, and embrace peer feedback on your work
Communicate constructively with peers, seniors and stakeholders in
     all territories
Work with engineers across the team to maintain the robustness and
     efficiency of our pipeline
Work collaboratively with 3rd parties to enable and support
     continuous improvement of our configuration practices, application
     quality, tooling and agile processes

title: Agile Coach Tiempo Completo
description:
Agile Coach
 
We’ve created InstaCarro
and built a robust tech platform: with more than 22 Million dollars in funds
raised and with our tech team located in Santo Domingo, Zona Colonial. 
That is just the
beginning, and we’re super proud of it. But the best is yet to come.
Relentlessly discovering
and inventing new ideas and technologies that will make things better for
partners and customers, and bringing them together around a better mobility services.
We’re proud of what
we’ve built, and the countless ways we’ve connected people that wants to sell
their car with hundres of buyers that will buy the car in less than 90 minutes,
instead of months. Now we can’t wait to make it even better - we’re creating
the world’s greatest mobility platform!
The opportunity
The
Agile Coach works with multiple teams who are at varying levels of software
engineering maturity to determine the current state of the team’s software
engineering processes. As an Agile Coach at InstaCarro, you are passionate
about Agile, communication, group dynamics and coaching. You are not afraid to
raise issues and drive change to remove impediments from your team and to
improve the organization. The Agile Coach helps teams develop a plan to improve
their software engineering methodologies with the end goal of helping to create
autonomous, self-organizing, empowered, and continuously improving teams.
You will be responsible
for training, coaching and mentoring Agile Scrum/Kanban methodologies of
various team members to ensure effective application of the iterative
principles and applicable standards in alignment with the agile methodologies.
What can you expect from
us?

Coach and mentor teams in the
     principles and practices of the iterative process.
Coach on key principles
     including team ownership and self-organization, effective user stories,
     relative estimation, etc.
Coach Product Owners in user
     story elaboration to make sure all user stories meet the defined checklist
     including acceptance criteria.
Coach Product Owners with
     backlog grooming activities and assure execution alignment.
Shadow roles on the Scrum team
     to facilitate learning through practice immersion.
Mentor individuals for personal
     and professional growth when appropriate.
Facilitate/Conduct planning
     sessions at multiple levels, including planning at the strategic, roadmap,
     release, and sprint levels.
Facilitate/Conduct Agile
     methodology training workshops, meetings, briefings and team offsites for
     all team members (Scrum Masters, Dev, QA, Technical Program Managers,
     etc).
Support/Advise on tools usage
     including setup, management, and governance (JIRA, Confluence, etc.) so
     that the teams support the InstaCarro’s SDLC.
Actively identifying waste and
     areas of improvement in the software development process.
You will work daily with Scrum Masters
     (in some cases act as SM), Product Owners,and the Team.

Required skills and
experience

University degree in Software
     Engineering, Computer Science, Industrial Design, Management Information
     Systems or equivalent program/experience.
Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or
     equivalent  certification is a plus
You have more than three years’
     experience working as an Agile Coach, Scrum Master, Product Owner or Team
     Lead with agile software development teams.
Minimum one year implementing
     Agile practices in an enterprise environment.
Minimum two years of experience
     in implementing process changes in a large software development
     organization.
Minimum two years of actual
     work experience performing a number of roles (Product, Developer, QA,
     Operations) in a software development organization.
Minimum one year of management
     experience.
You have experience using a
     combination of lean and agile practices to help teams succeed and
     organizations evolve.
Thorough knowledge of the
     various Software Development Life Cycle methodologies (Agile, Kanban,
     Scrum-ban, Lean, Waterfall, Iterative).

Competencies that are considered assets

Certified Team / Enterprise
     Coach
Familiar with Scaled Agile
     Framework (SAFe)
Experience with Atlassian tools
     (JIRA, Confluence, HipChat).

Soft Skills and
Competencies

You have a genuine passion for
     helping teams and individuals grow using a pragmatic approach.
You have the ability to work
     with high-performing teams and challenge them to improve even further.
Strong leadership skills;
     ability to cope with pressure.
Strong Project Management
     skills.
Demonstrated ability to work
     consultatively and influence change.
Strong interpersonal,
     facilitation and conflict resolution skills.
Ability to work independently
     with minimal supervision.
Ability of working fast in a
     fast-paced environment.
Ability to plan and prioritize
     multiple tasks and adapt to changing priorities.
Clear verbal and written
     communication skills (terse, clear and complete).
Strong presentation skills.
Excellent technical writing
     skills and ability to describe clearly complex processes and tasks.
You are a team player who is
     detail oriented and has superb organizational skills.

title:
Full-stack Javascript Developer (Remote) Independiente
Remoto
description: About X-Team“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.We are a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. Learn more about how we can help you learn and grow at https://x-team.com/unleash/About You:The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.Most important:Professional experience with JavascriptExperience with JS-based frameworks (Node.js, React)Experience with testing frameworksCode optimization and performance improvementsWrite high-performance, reusable code for UI componentsCompetent with revision control systems (Git)?Nice to have:* Experience with working remotely* Familiar/involved with open­ source projectsPersonal:* Independent, self-motivated* Fluent in English, written and spoken* Proven track record of always learning and growing.* Proactive attitude* Possess a spirit of generosityBenefits:* Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.* Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.* Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.* Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to join engaging engineering roundtable discussions, AMAs, gaming clubs, LAN parties, charitable fundraisers, fitness programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.* We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth each day through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more. (http://x-team.com/unleash)FAQ:Who is X-Team meant for?Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.What are you hiring for right now?We are hiring for Javascript developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We're also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.Will I get a job immediately after applying?If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.What kind of opportunities do you provide?We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.?

¿Quiénes
somos?
MullenLowe
Interamerica, somos una agencia de publicidad que no cree en la existencia del
“Above the line” or “Below the line”, creemos en “Just the line”.  Estamos
comprometidos con nuestros clientes a darles lo mejor de nuestro talento y
conectar con sus consumidores donde quiera se encuentren. Nuestra red global
está compuesta por diversas agencias que son únicas, rica en cultura local y
experiencia tanto a pequeña como a gran escala, presente en más de 65 mercados,
con más de 90 agencias.

buscando un desarrollador de back-end para unirse a nuestro equipo digital.

población Dominicana. Es una oportunidad para contribuir directamente con el
crecimiento y éxito de nuestros marcas en su presencia digital. Estamos
buscando a un candidato calificado y motivado, que sea apasionado del
desarrollo de sitios web y pueda crear códigos limpios que sean reutilizables.

de la posición:
El
desarrollador back-end estará encargado de crear el funcionamiento y la lógica
de las aplicaciones web y trabaja junto con el equipo de diseño digital para

códigos a fin de mantener el funcionamiento optimo y seguridad de los mismos.

description: Introduction   GBH is a company with specialized divisions in software (mobile, web, big data), information technology, consulting and execution of digital marketing initiatives.In GBH, we develop initiatives that provide measurable results to our clients in the aforementioned business units. We strive to serve as a strategic ally in the pursue of innovation, development and growth of their businesses.DescriptionGBH is looking for an experienced Software Quality Assurance Senior to plan, design, execute and automate tests. We have Agile and waterfall teams so previous experience working in a QA Team in these framework(s) is a must. The Individual chosen for this position should be a hands-on Software QA Analyst with proven technical and analytical skills. If you enjoy a highly collaborative environment, then this position might be for you!Responsibilities  Participate in the whole software development lifecycle by reviewing documentation and making sure they meet good quality standards.Direct analysis of documentation and technical specifications for any application under deployment or consideration to determine its intended functionalityPlan tests based on formal and informal documentation by creating well-structured Test Plans.Design tests by creating well detailed Test Cases and Test Scripts.Create more efficient regression testing efforts by automating manual tests.Execute manual tests for front-end and back-end working environments.Report defects, bugs and errors on any application under test.Follow up on reported issues during the bugs lifecycle.Be a mentor for Junior QA staff.Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related Leadership Ability to work as a team  Experience Experience using a variety of software development methodologies (Waterfall, Phase Gate, SCRUM, Kanban, etc.) Experience in modern test automation 3+ years of overall experience delivering enterprise-class software solutions Familiarity with bug and feature tracking systems such as JIRA a plus. Experience using a variety of software development methodologies (Waterfall, Phase Gate, SCRUM, Kanban, etc.) Testing environment include a variety of web and mobile solutions that include: React.js, Angular 1 and 2, Java, .NET, PHP, Elixir, Node.js, React Native, Android and IOS

title: Senior Technical Product Manager Tiempo Completo
description: DescriptionAs a Senior Technical Product Manager, you will own the development of our product experience with a focus on the technical applications. You will balance priorities and stakeholders to create a feature roadmap and ship product continuously. You are practical, understand that details are the product, and can prioritize and focus the Design and Engineering teams until the work is done. You are obsessed with technical development, user experience, and service design. You’ll have a deep understanding of the user experience and use it to build a realistic vision of what “success” is - doing whatever it takes to make that vision a reality. You are part architect, part executor, and always detail and data driven. You’ll be working with all functions of the business, building relationships and positioning yourself as a leader of the product.  ResponsibilitiesServe as a powerful link between service operations and engineering to iteratively execute improvements to our technical platform - by designing the most efficient and creative technical ways to balance immediate quick wins, and specing and managing the build and successful deployment of future forward features. Take ownership of the technical product, balancing all important factors to dramatically increase customer acquisition, customer satisfaction / retention and maximize efficiency on the back end. Can influence others and work with multiple functions; gets others to adopt your priorities and do the things necessary to help the product succeed. Be a strategic thinker - asks the right questions to push the team and product forward, understands where the market is and where it’s going. You can analyze data to make testable hypotheses and move forward based on results. Focus on relevant factors and ignore trivial factors and data “noise.”   Care deeply about our customers. Listen to them, but also probe deeper into underlying problems to get at the compelling value proposition for the customer. Understand the architectural and business capabilities of the competition. Know how to differentiate our product from the rest of the market. Constantly monitor assumptions - knows what the most important assumptions are, and re-evaluates them as soon as an assumption is threatened. Have the chance to shape a growing organization with its design, processes and operations. Required skills 5+ years product management experience and a strategic approach to product development You’re strategic, creative, and get stuff done Experience with category defining, innovative product preferred Great at providing clear, written product specifications  Comfortable with large scale data and data analysis and can iterate based on results Have vision, creativity, and divergent thinking Passionate about all things product Enjoy collaboration and working in a team environment Empathy and ability to articulate user needs Expansive knowledge of technical approaches, solutions and methods to solve a problem

title: Project Manager Tiempo Completo
description: PROJECT MANAGER Passionate about Project Management? Cloud Technology? Client Engagement? We are a team of world-class consultants, project managers and developers who solve people / culture, process, technology and data-related challenges in the media sector. We are seeking Project Managers to join our global team. This is a truly unique role, offering the right candidate a balance of project management and technology consulting duties in a dynamic environment. You would be working with global media organizations and their executives while being surrounded by incredibly talented colleagues as you solve strategic business problems.You will embark on an exciting growth path where you will be mentored and trained in world-class project management methodologies with hands-on, collaborative learning through experiential work on client projects as well as content-based learning through robust training resources. ABOUT ChinolaCloud (V2 Strategic Advisors "V2" Sister Company)ChinolaCloud is the nearshore office for V2 Strategic Advisors providing development and project management support to V2's global client base. V2 is a boutique management and technology consultancy headquartered in New York City with offices in the US, Europe and Latin America. We specialize in process improvement, organizational change management and Cloud systems integration for global media organizations. We have been a Salesforce.com partner for 10+ years and work with prominent media companies across print, digital, programmatic, business information services, entertainment and other media sectors. What sets V2 apart is our years of experience in solving some of the most challenging strategic and operational challenges in media through our focused and agile approach.Our strategy is simple: build a world-class team of individuals who collaborate around cloud technology and industry best practices. Clients will quickly realize that V2 and ChinolaCloud's incredibly talented developers, project managers and consultants, industry-specific solutions and agile delivery framework help streamline the process and provide results quickly. SNAPSHOT Teamwork / Culture - Our boutique culture is refreshing. Begin and end your work day with a group of incredibly talented, growth-minded people who embrace humility, teamwork and a common set of core values. Our clients consistency in the way we work and the results we deliver with integrity. It's energizing to be part of a winning team. Your Day - ChinolaCloud and V2 leverages best-in-class Cloud technologies like Slack, Google for Work, Todoist and Salesforce - and, of course, we are "Mac people". Every day begins with a virtual team scrum over a cafecito where we share our successes, overcome hurdles and refine our approach to projects. Your day-to-day activities will span myriad capabilities depending on the stage of your client engagement: Participating in Requirements Gathering / Needs Assessment Sessions Mapping Out and Optimizing Clients' Process Flows Building Salesforce Prototypes Participating in Client Conference Room Pilot Demos Assisting with Data, Integration and Analytics Activities Assisting with Training Sessions Assisting in Managing Project Track (s) Growth - Experience continuous mentorship and growth based on ChinolaCloud's / V2's unique "JPC" program. JPC helps each team member, regardless of their professional experience, realize growth and balance spanning Job, Personal Life and Career. As part of our recruitment process, you will begin to build an individualized JPC plan across key focus areas. From your first week, we will provide growth opportunities through client engagements and individually tailored or group JPC trainings. Collaborative bi-annual reviews focusing on past and future growth in key focus areas ensure more structured feedback in addition to weekly mentoring. KEY RESPONSIBILITIESParticipate in client conversations around people, process, Map out key process flows Incorporate business findings and recommendations into intelligent systems design Build a deep understanding of business and technology trends in media and Demonstrate thought leadership With clients, colleagues and overall the business community Translate business requirements into technical specifications Collaborate With team members Throughout Entire Spanning Salesforce engagement lifecycle design, configuration, build, testing, deployment and post go-live support Present solutions and gain feedback from clients through user testing sessions Assist with data cleansing activities Assist With end-user andtraining documentation Salesforce.com certifications DESIRED CAPABILITIES and ExperienceMinimum three (3) to five (5) years of professional experience Bachelor's degree in engineering, economics, technology or business Proven ability to use computers and software (no coding requirements) Strong communication skills Both in verbal and written English We are a native speaker and we will help you grow Strong organizational, task and management skills Ability to adapt to fast paced Quickly environments Strong organization skills and productivity International Living and working experience a plus Prior experience working Within the US with us to plus PMP or PMI certification to plus

title: Desarrollador Tiempo Completo
description: Apasionado por la programación? ¿La nube? Resolver problemas complejos?Somos un equipo de desarrolladores y consultores de clase mundial que resuelven retos de gente/cultura, procesos, tecnología y los desafíos de data/integración en la industria mediática. Estamos buscando contratar a un desarrollador para unirse a nuestro equipo global.Se trata de una posición verdaderamente única, que ofrece al candidato adecuado una oportunidad para construir sus habilidades de programación en una de las plataformas Cloud más emocionantes y de más rápido crecimiento en el mundo - Salesforce.com. Trabajaras con clientes globales y a estar rodeado de compañeros de increíble talento para resolver los problemas estratégicos del negocio.Si usted tiene experiencia en frontend y backend de desarrollo web, una sólida experiencia en programación orientada a objetos, como en Java y / o dominan el HTML, CSS y Javascript a continuación, esta oportunidad puede ser una buena opción para usted. Usted se embarcará en una senda de crecimiento interesant, donde será tutelado y capacitado en la plataforma Salesforce con el aprendizaje práctico, de colaboración a través del trabajo experimental en proyectos de clientes, así como el aprendizaje basado en contenidos a través de los recursos de formación robustos.ACERCA ChinolaCloud (compañia hermana de V2 Strategic Advisors “V2”)ChinolaCloud es la oficina nearshore que proporciona a V2 Strategic Advisors servicios de desarrollo y consultoría para apoyar a la clientela global de V2. V2 es una firma consultora boutique de gerencia y tecnología con sede en la ciudad de Nueva York, y oficinas en los EE.UU., Europa y América Latina. Somos especialistas en la mejora de procesos, gestión del cambio organizacional e integración de sistemas en la nube para organizaciones de medios de comunicación globales. Hemos sido socios de Salesforce.com por más de 10 años y trabajamos con prominentes compañías de medios en sectores como medios de impresión, digitales, programaticos, servicios de informacion empresarial, entretenimiento y otras areas de la industria. Lo que hace único a V2 son nuestros años de experiencia en la solución de algunos de los retos estratégicos y operativos más difíciles en la industria de medios de comunicación a través de nuestro enfoque centrado y ágil.Nuestra estrategia es simple: construir un equipo de clase mundial de personas que colaboren usando tecnologías en la nube y las mejores prácticas de la industria, desde nuestra sede central en Manhattan. Los clientes se dan cuenta rápidamente de que los talentosos desarrolladores y consultores de V2 y ChinolaCloud, las soluciones específicas de la industria y framework de entrega ágil ayudan a agilizar el proceso y proporcionan resultados eficientemente.SNAPSHOTTrabajo en equipo / Cultura - Nuestra cultura de Boutique es refrescante. Comenzaras y terminarás el día junto a un grupo de gente increíblemente talentosa, con mentalidad de crecimiento, y que comparten la humildad, el trabajo en equipo y un conjunto de valores comunes fundamentales. Nuestros clientes consistentemente elogian nuestra forma de trabajar y los resultados que ofrecemos con integridad. Es energizante formar parte de un equipo exitoso.Tu día - ChinolaCloud y V2 aprovecha las mejores tecnologías de nube como Slack, Google para el Trabajo, Todoist y Salesforce - y, por supuesto, somos "gente Mac". Cada día comienza con un scrum del equipo virtual al lado un cafecito. En este compartimos nuestros éxitos, superamos obstáculos y refinamos nuestro enfoque en los proyectos. Tus actividades del día a día se extenderán a varias capacidades en función de la etapa de involucramiento con el cliente:Participar en la captura de requisitos / sesiones de evaluación de necesidades Creación de especificaciones técnicas y diseños de soluciones basadas en códigoSoluciones basadas en código de Salesforce (Apex, Visualforce, Javascript, CSS, HTML)Configuración de la plataforma SalesforceAyudar con tareas de data e integraciónRealización de control de calidad críticoCrecimiento - Experimentaras tutoría continua y crecimiento basado en el programa “JPC”, único de V2 ChinolaCloud. JPC ayuda a cada miembro del equipo, independientemente de su experiencia profesional, a lograr crecimiento y balance que abarca las áreas del trabajo, la vida personal y profesional. Como parte de nuestro proceso de reclutamiento, comenzarás por construir un plan personalizado de  crecimiento JPC, cubriendo áreas de enfoque claves. Desde tu primera semana te ofrecemos oportunidades de crecimiento a través de compromisos con los clientes y entrenamientos JPC, personalizados tanto para individuos como para equipos. Revisiones bianuales colaborativas y centradas en el crecimiento pasado y futuro en nuestras áreas clave de enfoque te aseguran una retroalimentación más estructurada, además de del apoyo y seguimiento semanal.RESPONSABILIDADES CLAVE Participar en conversaciones con clientes en torno a los retos técnicos/de negocio clavesTraducir los requerimientos del negocio a especificaciones técnicasDesarrollar soluciones de frontend y backend dentro de la plataforma de SalesforceColaborar con los miembros del equipo a lo largo de todo el ciclo de vida que abarca el diseño, configuración de Salesforce, construcción/desarrollo, pruebas, despliegue y apoyo post-desplieguePresentar diseños de soluciones y recibir retroalimentación de clientes mediantes sesiones de user testingRealizar control de calidad adecuada en las bases de códigoAyudar con las actividades de limpieza de datosAyudar con la creación y mantenimiento de documentación del códigoAdquirir y mantener las certificaciones de Salesforce.com que apliquenCapacidades deseadas Y EXPERIENCIAMínimo de tres ( 3) a cinco (5 ) años de experiencia profesionalGrado (s) en ciencias de la computación o programaciónPasión por resolver problemas de negocio mediante el uso de tecnologías de la nubeExperiencia en programación frontend/backend relevante (Java, PHP, Python, HTML, JavaScript, CSS)Experiencia programando en la plataforma Salesforce preferido pero no requeridoCapacidad demostrada para gestionar proyectos de programación a través de todo el ciclo de vidaCapacidad de adaptarse rápidamente a entornos de ritmo rápidoHabilidades sólidas de organización y productividadhabilidades de comunicación efectiva en Inglés requeridas (oral y escrito)

architecture and data modeling

years developing web apps using Microsoft .NET Framework (ASP.NET, ASP.NET

with one or more of the following: NServiceBus, developing micro services,

in best practices used to develop enterprise web applications, including

researching and prototyping new innovations.

problem solving and debugging skills.

The
ability to work in a fast paced team environment with aggressive schedules.
