title: Mobile App Designer Tiempo Completo
description:
ResponsibilitiesOur guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our 
business.  As a designer in our mobile team you’ll be a key part of the 
idea generation process, working in a small start up-like group which 
takes full ownership of their part of our platform. You’ll be working on
 the iterative improvements we make as part of our high-speed release 
cycles, as well as looking ahead and conceptualizing broader changes our
 mobile app offers across all major platforms. You’ll work with 
developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to 
conceive, analyze & test your ideas. You will also contribute to the
 growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other 
recruitment efforts
B.skilled
You are excited to design native iOS and Android applications that 
millions of people use every day. You excel in solving problems that 
today’s mobile users face by focusing on their needs and designing a 
mobile experience tailored to that. You are familiar with the state of 
the art in native mobile app design and you are up-to-date with the 
latest trends and emerging new user interface patterns. Your portfolio 
isn’t a series of beautiful but generic templates – it’s a collection of
 stories that you can discuss with enthusiasm,and regret… because you’re
 always getting better at what you do and you’re never satisfied with 
“good enough”.Requirements.Experience: You have at least two years of relevant experience designing for smartphones / tablets
App Portfolio: Your portfolio of iOS / Android app designs 
demonstrates your excellent understanding of native app design patterns 
& platform guidelines
Simplicity: Good design is invisible
Collaboration: You’ll be working alongside developers and 
copywriters to create elegant user experiences; you should thrive on 
feedback, critique and iteration
Visual design: Sketch, Photoshop, Fireworks, MS Paint – whatever 
works for you. Your process is your own; you get to decide which tools 
you use
Design Process: You’ll be given full ownership of your ideas, and so
 you’ll be required to create beautiful experiences / mockups / 
prototypes —and follow up with their implementation
Data: You are a successful Designer, but you like to measure your success with data and learn from it every day
E-commerce: You understand the challenges and the opportunities that a large e-commerce service has to offer
Developer Tools: Familiarity with Xcode / Android Studio is a plus

title: Ingeniero de Software Senior (Web) Tiempo Completo
description: Introducción Soluciones GBH es una empresa con divisiones especializadas en tecnología de información, asesoría estratégica y ejecución de mercadeo, así como el desarrollo de productos web, móviles y big data. En GBH desarrollamos iniciativas que provean resultados medibles a nuestros clientes en todos estos espectros de negocio; sirviendo como un aliado estratégico que acompaña en la innovación, desarrollo y crecimiento de los negocios.DescripciónEl ingeniero de software senior está encargado de producir código y pruebas de un proyecto, asistir al Team Lead y al Design Lead en la toma de decisiones arquitecturales de bajo nivel.ObjetivosProducir código de ejecución y de pruebasColaborar, cuándo sea solicitado, en el diseño de las aplicaciones.Aportar conocimiento técnico al equipo para guiar a los junior engineer en sus responsabilidades técnicas.ResponsabilidadesProducir código fuente para proyectos internos o de clientes.Producir unit tests o integration tests para las partes de trabajo asignadas.Producir arquitecturas de bajo nivel a partir de la documentación de la arquitectura.RequisitosEgresado de grado universitario en ingeniería de sistemas y computación o carrera relacionada.Debe poder construir soluciones haciendo uso de estructuras de datos complejas. Por ejemplo: graphs y trees.Conocimiento y capacidad de aplicación de object oriented design; esta persona debe, dado un problema, poder estructurar su solución en clases, métodos y propiedades.Dominio de estrategias de testing top down y bottom up así como su implementación a través de unit testing y/o integration testing.Debe tener experiencia utilizando herramientas de control de versiones (GIT) y conocimiento del flujo de trabajo de la compañía.Escribir y leer inglés; esta persona debe poder leer libros, papeles técnicos o posts de blog y comprenderlos. Adicionalmente, debe poder generar un resumen de dicha lectura.3 años de experiencia en diseño y desarrollo de proyectos web.Conocimiento y capacidad de aplicar los principios SOLID y patrones de diseño.Capacidad de cumplir requerimientos dados por los atributos de calidad a través de decisiones de diseño.Dominio de las siguientes tecnologías y/o servicios:PHPLaravelHTMLCSSGitJavascriptJQueryWordPressMysqlPostgresCloud Experience: Heroku, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure

title: Front end Developer Tiempo Completo
description: Booking.com is looking for Front End Developers all around the globe! Join us at our beautiful headquarters in Amsterdam and work on planet Earth’s #1 accommodation website with some of the industry’s smartest people!Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a Developer in the Front End team you’ll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in small startup-like teams that take full ownership of their part of our platform. You’ll work side by side with designers, back end developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyze, hand code & test your ideas. You’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of users.Our ideal candidate has an excellent eye for detail, pragmatic approach and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug free. We make all of our decisions based on experiments and testing, so you should be excited by taking a data-led approach to development. If you believe you’re also a passionate advocate for the user, and are looking to work in an agile, collaborative environment than we would like to hear from you! adResponsibilitiesTranslate requirements and mockups into fully functioning features using JavaScript and HTML/CSSContinuously look for ways to improve Booking.com and implement A/B testsTake ownership of sections of Booking.com‘s desktop, tablet and mobile web sitesContribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts       Requirements4+ years of experience in a relevant role, preferably in a commercial environmentExpert understanding of core front-end web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)Experience with JavaScript libraries such as JQueryExperience with templating languagesAbility to write high-performance, reusable codeExperience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issuesExperience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etcKnowledge of version control systemsComfortable working on a command lineExcellent English communication skills, both written and verbal

title: Desarrollador Tiempo Completo
description: DEVELOPERPassionate about programming? Cloud? Solve complex problems?We are a world-class team of developers and consultants who solve challenges of people / culture, processes, technology and the challenges of data / integration in the media industry. We are looking to hire a developer to join our global team.This is a truly unique position, which gives you the opportunity to build your proficiency skills on one of the most exciting and fast growing cloud platforms in the world - Salesforce.com. You will work with global clients and be surrounded by incredibly talented colleagues to solve strategic business problems.If you have experience in frontend and backend web development, the solid experience in object-oriented programming, such as in Java and / or dominate the HTML, CSS and Javascript then this opportunity may be a good choice for you. You will embark on an interesting growth path, where you will be tutored and trained in the Salesforce platform with hands-on learning, collaboration through experimental work on client projects, as well as content-based learning through training resources Robust.ABOUT ChinolaCloud (sister company of V2 Strategic Advisors "V2")ChinolaCloud is the nearshore office that provides V2 Strategic Advisors with development and consulting services to support V2's global clientele. V2 is a boutique management and technology consulting firm based in New York City, with offices in the US, Europe and Latin America. We specialize in process improvement, organizational change management and cloud systems integration for global media organizations. We have been partners with Salesforce.com for more than 10 years and we work with prominent media companies in sectors such as print media, digital media, programming, business information services, entertainment and other areas of the industry.Our strategy is simple: to build a world-class team of people who collaborate using cloud technologies and industry best practices from our headquarters in Manhattan. Customers quickly realize that the talented developers and consultants of V2 and ChinolaCloud, industry-specific solutions and agile delivery framework help streamline the process and deliver results efficiently.SNAPSHOTTeamwork / Culture - Our Boutique culture is refreshing. You will begin and end the day with a group of incredibly talented, growth-minded people who share humility, teamwork and a set of core values. Our clients consistently praise our work and the results we deliver with integrity. It is energizing to be part of a successful team.Your day - ChinolaCloud and V2 takes advantage of the best cloud technologies like Slack, Google for Work, Todoist and Salesforce - and, of course, we are "Mac people". Every day begins with a scrum of the virtual team next to a cafecito. In this we share our successes, overcome obstacles and refine our focus on projects. Your day-to-day activities will be extended to various capacities depending on the stage of involvement with the client:Participate in the capture of requirements / needs assessment sessions Creation of technical specifications and design of solutions based on codeSalesforce code-based solutions (Apex, Visualforce, Javascript, CSS, HTML)Configuring the Salesforce PlatformHelping with data and integration tasksPerforming critical quality controlGrowth - Experience ongoing mentoring and growth based on the "JPC" program, unique to V2 ChinolaCloud. JPC helps each team member, regardless of their professional experience, to achieve growth and balance that covers the areas of work, personal and professional life. The part of our recruitment process, you will begin by building a personalized JPC growth plan, covering key focus areas. From your first week we provide you with opportunities for engaging with clients and JPC training, customized for both individuals and teams. Biannual collaborative reviews focused on past and future growth in our key focus areas ensure you more structured feedback, as well as weekly support and follow-up.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Engage in customer conversations around key technical / business challengesTranslate business requirements to technical specificationsDevelop frontend and backend solutions within the Salesforce platformCollaborate with team members throughout the lifecycle of design, configuration, Salesforce configuration / development, testing, deployment and post-deployment supportPresent solutions designs and receive feedback from clients through user testing sessionsPerform adequate quality control in the code basesAssist with data cleansing activitiesAssist with the creation and maintenance of code documentationAcquire and maintain Salesforce.com certifications that applyDesired Capabilities AND EXPERIENCEMinimum of three (3) to five (5) years of professional experienceDegree (s) in computer science or programmingPassion for solving business problems through the use of cloud technologiesExperience in relevant frontend / backend programming (Java, PHP, Python, HTML, JavaScript, CSS)Experience programming in the preferred Salesforce platform but not requiredDemonstrated ability to manage programming projects throughout the lifecycleAbility to adapt quickly to fast-paced environmentsStrong Organizational and Productivity SkillsEffective communication skills in English required (oral and written)

is a full time position. The Database
Developer is responsible for the analysis, design, documentation, development,

Design,
develop, test, tune, and implement database objects and any supporting T-SQL

Recommends
and provide guidance regarding database development, T-SQL best practices, and

and propose technical design documentation which includes current and future
functionality, database objects affected, specifications, and flows/diagrams to
detail the proposed implementation.
Mentors,
supports and offers SQL guidance to other application development staff and
team members.

title, only a representative summary of the primary duties and

title: DevOps Tiempo Completo
description: Specific ResponsibilitiesThe DevOps Engineer will be responsible for authoring scripts under the direction of the DevOps lead in our AWS and Azure environments. These scripts will impact the provisioning, monitoring, automation, and upkeep of these systems. This includes interfacing with the testing and QA teams pre-deployment, and delivering on expectations with the end users. The candidate will be expected to utilize DomiNET’s tools and processes including JIRA; be cognizant of the instantiation and automation scripts through maintenance and operations tasks, and building appropriate documentation. Specific tasks include:Creating, reviewing, modifying, and updating scripts for the following types of resources:Infrastructure Devices such as Elastic Load Balancers, Routers, Servers, and FirewallsOperating System configurations and patching including various flavors of Windows and LinuxCOTS Applications such as Microsoft Office, WinZip, Firefox, and other standard packagesWork with the DevOps Team lead to prioritize work, identify areas for improvement, and offer new solutions to automate legacy processesAnswer technical questions to other DomiNET staff about automation capabilitiesPropose changes to exiting solutions to improve operations and supportDeliver solutions in an Agile methodology with quick turn-around times, high availability, and low defect countsAssist the DomiNET Security resources to deploy FISMA and FedRAMP controls in an automated and repeatable fashionAuthor technical documentation to capture their workUtilize tools to monitor the environment for usability and functional metrics to implement measurable functional and usability improvementsGeneral FocusThe general focus of this position is to automate the build, support, and operations of our new cloud solutions. This position will be critical to advancing the automation, provisioning, monitoring, and maintenance of IT resources and services.Skills/Knowledge Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline; experience in the managing or designing cloud platforms, communications, and server environments; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience0 - 2 years of relevant work experience in Information Technology, specifically in cloud automation, preferably in AWSExperience with scripting in Windows or transferable languagesUnderstanding of cloud architectures, networking, system administration, architectures and security elements, virtualization technologies, encryption, and serversTime management skills, and the ability to prioritize and multi-task without daily directionSelf-motivated and able to work with a team to tackle issues as they arise and effectively influence others who are involvedWilling to take charge independently to offer opportunities to improve services related to the job they are performingVendor and other Technical certifications are a plusHave questions? contact us to jobs@dominet.net

title: Hiring Virtual Desktop Engineer Tiempo Completo
description: Specific ResponsibilitiesThe Virtual Desktop Engineer will be responsible for all aspects of the end user’s experience on DomiNET’s virtual desktop platforms. This includes meeting with the users to gather constructive feedback and converting the feedback into actionable user stories or epics for improving the image or automation by the DevOps team. This also includes being the technical owner of the VDI images and backend infrastructure supporting the solution. Specific tasks include:Build a Windows 10 VDI image that meets Security’s requirements, has built in metrics and reporting, and integrates with automated operations toolsEnsure the delivery of the Windows 10 image is within acceptable Critical-to-Quality metrics globally and taking ownership of issues that stop it from doing soWork with customers, implementation partners, and internal IT staff to:Discover ongoing issues and new opportunities to improve the VDI solutionsInformally answer technical questions to other DomiNET staff about our service and best practicesPropose changes to DomiNET’s architecture, infrastructure, and applications to make full use of the VDI environmentWork closely with the DevOps Team Lead to identify opportunities to script and automate repeated operations tasks and improvements continuously throughout the lifecycle of the solutionsWork with the Enterprise and Cloud Architects to define hardware requirements and options for accessing VDI solutionsSupport Tier 3 calls when the Service Center and DevOps teams cannot solve an issueEnsure the systems adhere to all relevant patching, operations, and security standards on a weekly basisReview CloudFormation and Puppet scripts for Operating System configurations and patching including various flavors of Windows and Linux and COTS Applications such as Microsoft Office, WinZip, Firefox, and other standard packagesDeliver solutions in an Agile methodology with quick turn-around times, high availability, and low defect countsAssist the DomiNET Security resources to learn how to automate implementation of FISMA and FedRAMP Moderate controlsAuthor technical documentation to capture the implemented system design, operations manuals, and hand-off manuals for the IT Service Center (help desk) and other Tier 1 or Tier 2 functionalityGeneral FocusThe general focus of this position is to own and champion VDI solutions for DomiNET’s global workforce. This includes implementing the future of desktop and mobile services while also focusing on a low-touch operation model through the use of automation-first approaches and quality metrics to identify problems before the users do. This position will be expected to significantly advance the automation, provisioning, monitoring, and maintenance of DomiNET’s desktop experience in a short time frameSkills/Knowledge Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline and 3 years’ experience in the development of user desktop images; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.5 - 7 years of total relevant work experience in Information Technology, specifically in virtualization environments, ideally in virtualization of desktopsAdvanced knowledge in Windows 10 Operating system controls (registry, profiles, services and components)Demonstrated understanding of Active Directory design and controls (Group Policy, Login Scripts, and authentication).Experience with application packaging, preferably in a virtualized environmentStrong experience with running SCCM 2012 configuration managerDemonstrated ability to research new methods for enhancing performance, reliability, optimization tuning and overall user experienceExperience identifying desktop solutions and products including hardware standards for end usersExperience working in the Agile Software Development Life-CycleTime management skills, and the ability to prioritize and multi-task without daily directionSelf-motivated and able to work with a team to tackle issues as they arise and effectively influence others who are involvedWilling to take charge independently to offer opportunities to improve services related to the job they are performingFamiliarity with regulatory and legal requirements (i.e., FISMA, SOX, HIPAA requirements)Strong technical certifications are a plus

This fulltime position will report to ERC IT management and
will be responsible for serving as a liaison cross
functionally to analyze and document business and user needs. This position requires
day-to-day interaction with resources in IT, Client Services, Finance, Project
Management, Operations, Clients, Vendors and possibly corporate leadership.
 
Responsibilities include: 
Leads requirements gathering sessions and
actively participates in all project meetings.
Documents requirements that capture
business needs and process scenarios. Researches, documents and clarifies
process and workflow questions.
Accountable for understanding and
communicating accurate business requirements to IT partners and ensuring
technical specifications accurately reflect business needs. 
Recommends improvements to achieve and deliver
high quality, value-added services, and identifies opportunities for application
enhancements. 
Facilitates evaluation of delivered technology
solution to ensure it satisfies the business needs. Accountable for triaging
issues, identifying root cause of systemic issues and ensuring a fix is
identified and implemented. 
Builds internal partnerships ensuring effective communication,
coordination, collaboration and working relationships. Ensures client needs and
expectations are met. 
May participate in any or all testing tasks such
as identifying and writing test scenarios, conditioning test data, and
executing test plans.
Participates in monitoring and evaluating
the effectiveness of technology solutions, policies, practices and processes of
released applications. 
Stays current on best practices and technologies as it relates to the
analysis, design and documentation of technical solutions.
Facilitates and/or leads internal and
external discussions.

title: IMPLEMENTATION AND SUPPORT ENGINEERING Tiempo Completo
description:
Description
Support Engineer position will be required to coordinate, manage and provide
Technical Support for COMSOL Provided Services after Implementation of services
has been completed.  This role also
includes additional responsibilities where necessary such as Integration of
Network & Operational Management of Circuits.  Person in this position will ensure
compliance to policies and standards for Process, Technology and Security. 
-       
Be part of a technical team in charge of
troubleshooting Voice / Data solutions.
-       
Hands on & Execution of Implementation works
for new, changes and upgrade of Services provided and carried out in compliance
with best practices.
-       
Maintain and manage escalation procedures and SLA
assurance in terms of implementation intervals as committed to customers.
-       
Providing Point of escalation Contact for 1st level
troubleshooting with end-to-end ownership for technical support carried out in
compliance with best practices.
-       
Incident Management: Provide Single Point of
Contact to fix or escalate incidents with agreed Mean-Time-To-Recover (MTTR)
for service restoration and also using tools to analyze incident and ensuring
process compliance.
-       
Being a member of Technical Recovery Team to resolve
severe incidents and also escalation to Management followed with Post Incident
Review of Work Process & Instructions.
-       
Actively participate in service recovery calls to
ensure the focus is maintained by all support chain participants through normal
day to day operations or during Incident recovery.
-       
Change Management: Responsible to validate and vet
Change Request to ensure compliance that includes verification checks &
fallback procedures.
-  Sharing of
support knowledge and experience across the board to COMSOL team. 
-  Be able to
visit technical sites within the US and outside the US in order to sign-off on
technical work.
-  Prepare
periodic technical reports to submit to Senior Management.
 
Qualifications
 
Bilingual (writing and speaking)
Bachelor's degree in an Engineering discipline or
Computer Science (desirable) or equivalent experience (1 - 2 years)
Remote Support Experience covering 24 x 7 mission
critical business environment.
Understanding of SDH & SONET technologies and Data
flow architecture. 
Highly motivated individual, with a positive &
pro-active attitude to work, and willingness to make changes to improve
operational efficiency through innovation, process and procedure, and adopting
and adapting ideas and practices from elsewhere.
Ability to act rapidly and logically under
pressure, and make effective use of others in resolving problems.
Ability to work in shift and flexible schedule.
Writing Skills for Documentation, Building &
Maintaining Relationships, Problem Solving and Decision Making, end to end
ownership for customer satisfaction through levels of support, planning and
organization & working well with Virtual Team are the required key soft
skills.
Technical Support and Implementation roles IPLC
services preferred 
Good knowledge of Microsoft 
Strong communication skills

Implementation & Support Engineer 
Job Description
Description
 
Support Engineer position will be required to coordinate, manage and provide
Technical Support for COMSOL Provided Services after Implementation of services
has been completed.  This role also
includes additional responsibilities where necessary such as Integration of
Network & Operational Management of Circuits.  Person in this position will ensure
compliance to policies and standards for Process, Technology and Security. 
 
-       
Be part of a technical team in charge of
troubleshooting Voice / Data solutions.
-       
Hands on & Execution of Implementation works
for new, changes and upgrade of Services provided and carried out in compliance
with best practices.
-       
Maintain and manage escalation procedures and SLA
assurance in terms of implementation intervals as committed to customers.
-       
Providing Point of escalation Contact for 1st level
troubleshooting with end-to-end ownership for technical support carried out in
compliance with best practices.
-       
Incident Management: Provide Single Point of
Contact to fix or escalate incidents with agreed Mean-Time-To-Recover (MTTR)
for service restoration and also using tools to analyze incident and ensuring
process compliance.
-       
Being a member of Technical Recovery Team to resolve
severe incidents and also escalation to Management followed with Post Incident
Review of Work Process & Instructions.
-       
Actively participate in service recovery calls to
ensure the focus is maintained by all support chain participants through normal
day to day operations or during Incident recovery.
-       
Change Management: Responsible to validate and vet
Change Request to ensure compliance that includes verification checks &
fallback procedures.
-  Sharing of
support knowledge and experience across the board to COMSOL team. 
-  Be able to
visit technical sites within the US and outside the US in order to sign-off on
technical work.
-  Prepare
periodic technical reports to submit to Senior Management.
 
Qualifications
 
ü  Bilingual (writing and speaking)
ü  Bachelor's degree in an Engineering discipline or Computer Science
(desirable) or equivalent experience (1 - 2 years)
ü  Remote Support Experience covering 24 x 7 mission critical business
environment.
ü  Understanding of SDH & SONET technologies and Data flow architecture.

ü  Highly motivated individual, with a positive & pro-active attitude
to work, and willingness to make changes to improve operational efficiency
through innovation, process and procedure, and adopting and adapting ideas and
practices from elsewhere.
ü  Ability to act rapidly and logically under pressure, and make effective
use of others in resolving problems.
ü  Ability to work in shift and flexible schedule.
ü  Writing Skills for Documentation, Building & Maintaining
Relationships, Problem Solving and Decision Making, end to end ownership for
customer satisfaction through levels of support, planning and organization
& working well with Virtual Team are the required key soft skills.
ü  Technical Support and Implementation roles IPLC services preferred 
ü  Good knowledge of Microsoft 
ü  Strong communication skills.

title: Full Stack Web Engineer Tiempo Completo
description: TWG believes that software is the most powerful tool to drive positive change for the world. For the past twelve years, we’ve worked with some of the most innovative organizations in the world, building award­winning web and mobile products. We have a team and culture that finds common ground and purpose in learning, craftsmanship and excellence.  Our full stack developers work alongside designers and product managers in an integrated team, taking ownership of entire products from conception through to fruition. Our ideal candidate is driven, creative, fun­loving and able to deliver high­quality work within the fast­paced environment at one of our studios. As A TWG Full Stack Web Developer, You Will: Plan, program, and deliver web applications using a variety of programming languages and development platforms including Ruby on Rails, node.js, php, and others. Work closely with our Business Development, Product and Project Managers and User Experience Designers to establish a detailed product specification through discussion with clients/users.Troubleshoot and support existing applications/systems Keep current with programming languages and platforms within the web development and application spaceIntegrate applications by designing database architecture and server scripting; studying and establishing connectivity with network systems, search engines, and information server Recommend system solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of custom development and purchase alternativesAssist in developing documentations such as user manual, presentations to technical staff/clientsAct as a go­to­person within technical area of expertiseTWG Is Looking From Someone Who:Is a natural tinkerer who is self­motivated to see how we can apply new technologies to real life problems Is able to work closely with business clients and has a strong understanding of the business process Can manage their time well Is experienced with Agile development and Lean business principles and Scrum development methodologyIs someone who learns from experience and likes to improve their process and practices Likes to collaborate within a group Likes to teach and speak to groups about technology and its application in life and business Essential Background And Skills: A  university degree in business management, computer science, computer programming, information systems or similar. A minimum of 3 years relevant web development experience, Knowledgeable in issue tracking and version control systems, experienced with git. Ability to design  and implement complex data architecture. Strong organizational skills with ability to coordinate activities. Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities. Excellent communication skills (oral and written); highly skilled in communicating in a clear, concise and precise manner. Experience leading small teams and projects is a bonus. BenefitsAt The Working Group, we believe software is the most powerful tool for change. Our ambition is to work with the most innovative companies in the world, and be the best place to learn, work, create & grow. What we bring:A team that creates and launches real products used by people around the world Work with world­class engineers, designers and product managers building great software for respected brands and up­-and­-coming startups Grow and build your own skills through collaboration with senior management, client representatives, and industry leadersA fast­paced environment that exposes you to many different clients, industries, problems and solutions Perks: A friendly environment with flexible office hours and a forward thinking approach to vacation and sabbaticals Comprehensive health coverage that includes prescriptions, dental, vision care, long­term disability and life insurance Funding for training courses and educational resources to accelerate your professional development We provide $1500 towards the computer setup of your choice so you can own your computer setup
